page.title: 05ALL SAINTS CHURCH, CHEBSEY
page.content: There has been a place of worship at Chebsey since Saxon days. In the churchyard are the remains of an ancient cross. This is a scheduled monument. The present Church dates from Norman times. The tradition of Master Mason's marks can be seen both in the 13th-century stonework and in the modern joinery. There are 4 bells and a 2-manual organ. An unusual feature is that the turret stair of the tower is external. Congregations average 23 people. There is no choir. The Priest is also in charge of the neighbouring parishes of Ellenhall and Norton Bridge. A service is held at Chebsey most Sundays. During the last year the Priest conducted 4 baptisms, 1 wedding and 2 funerals.
